title: Definitions
context: [PART V.] WATER POLLUTION CONTROL FINANCING Cross References Drinking water financing, see §§340E-31 to 41. §342D-80 Definitions. As used in this part, unless the context otherwise requires: &ldquo;American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009&rdquo; means the federal law, Public Law 111-5, making appropriations for various purposes, including job preservation and creation, infrastructure investment, energy efficiency and science, assistance to the unemployed, and state and local fiscal stabilization purposes. &ldquo;Corpus allocation&rdquo; means the amount of moneys in the revolving fund that is allocated by the director to provide earnings to reduce an eligible party&rsquo;s total financing costs for one or more eligible projects. &ldquo;Eligible party&rdquo; means a county, state agency, or private person. &ldquo;Revolving fund&rdquo; means the water pollution control revolving fund established by section 342D-83. [L 1997, c 221, pt of §1; am L 2002, c 132, §3; am L 2009, c 98, §5]
